required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Mirikizumab (LY3074828) in Participants With Crohn's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo- and Active- Controlled, Treat-Through Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Mirikizumab in Patients With Moderately to Severely Active Crohn's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The reason for this study is to see if the study drug mirikizumab is safe and effective in participants with moderately to severely active Crohn's disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Endoscopic Response
primary_outcome.description: Endoscopic response based on Simple Endoscopic Score for Crohn's Disease (SES-CD) total score

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Clinical Remission
primary_outcome.description: Clinical remission by Patient Reported Outcome (PRO) based on stool frequency (SF) and abdominal pain (AP)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Endoscopic Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic remission based on SES-CD total score

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Clinical Remission or Endoscopic Remission who were Corticosteroid Free
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission by PRO based on SF and AP and endoscopic remission based on SES-CD total score

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Clinical Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission by PRO is based on SF and AP

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Clinical Remission
Change from Baseline in C-Reactive Protein
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in C-Reactive Protein

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Fecal Calprotectin
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in fecal calprotectin

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Extraintestinal Manifestations (EIMs) of Crohn's Disease
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with EIMs of Crohn's Disease

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Fistulae Response
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with fistulae response

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Area Under the Concentration Time Curve (AUC) of Mirikizumab
Change from Baseline in Health Related Quality of Life
secondary_outcome.description: Health related quality of life based on Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire (IBDQ) score

arm_group.description: Mirikizumab given intravenously (IV) and subcutaneously (SC). Participants in the open-label adolescent addendum will be given mirikizumab IV and SC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of CD for at least 3 months prior to baseline
- Confirmed diagnosis of moderate to severe CD as assessed by SF, AP score, and SES-CD
- Demonstrated intolerance, loss of response or inadequate response to conventional or to biologic therapy for CD
- If female, subject must meet the contraception recommendations
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a current diagnosis of ulcerative colitis, inflammatory bowel disease-unclassified (IBD-U) (formerly known as indeterminate colitis) or short bowel syndrome
- Currently have or are suspected to have an abscess. Recent cutaneous and perianal abscesses are not exclusionary if drained, adequately treated and resolved at least 3 weeks prior to baseline or 8 weeks prior to baseline for intra-abdominal abscesses, provided that there is no anticipated need for any further surgery
- Have a stoma, ileoanal pouch or ostomy
- Have had a bowel resection within 6 months, or any kind of intra-abdominal or extra abdominal surgery within 3 months of baseline
- Have ever received any monoclonal antibodies binding IL-23

link.description: A Study of Mirikizumab (LY3074828) in Participants With Crohn's Disease

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
